Title: KETTLEBELL WEIGHT SHIFT
Directions: The kettlebell weight shift is a hip mobility exercise that is used to improve hip abduction and external rotation. Start by kneeling down on one leg have the target hip’s leg planted with the foot and knee pointed away from your midline. Hold a kettlebell with both hands relaxed in front of you and shift your pelvis in the same direction as the target hip’s foot.
Muscles Involved: Adductor Magnus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Longus
Related Conditions: Squat warm up / Squat hip shift
